hints.content:
**Perimeter** is the distance around the outside of a two-dimensional shape.

**Area** is the space inside of a two-dimensional shape. We can also think of area as the amount of space a shape covers.
Sally wants to find the amount of netting it will take to **cover** her garden, so she is finding the **area**.

Now, Sally needs to find out how much more netting she will need if she already has $12$ square meters of netting.

If Sally needs to cover $18$ square meters but already has $12$ square meters, how much more netting will she need?
$18\text{ square meters} - 12\text{ square meters} = 6\text{ square meters}$
Sally needs $6$ square meters of netting.

question.content:
Sally is building a garden. She plans to build a rectangular garden measuring $6$ meters by $3$ meters. She wants to put a net over top of the garden to keep the birds out. She has $12$ square meters of netting in her garage.

**How much more netting will Sally need to cover her whole garden?**
